text:
Hello -

I’m having an issue using the HubSpot CMS for our company logo. The source file is a high-quality PNG, but when it gets uploaded to the logo section it becomes blurry.

If I look at the source URL on the website it is (Blurry):
`<https://f.HubSpotusercontent10.net/hub/6001162/hubfs/rectangle-logo-transparent-400x120.png?width=189&height=50&name=rectangle-logo-transparent-400x120.png>`

But if I remove the information after the `?` , the image becomes clear:
`<https://f.HubSpotusercontent10.net/hub/6001162/hubfs/rectangle-logo-transparent-400x120.png>`


Looks like HubSpots standard compression is doing some nonsense. How can I fix this?

Hi <@U033EML9D37>

Is there a height and width tag set on the logo element?
Check this doc out: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/files/automatic-image-resizing-on-HubSpot-content>

HubSpot has an image resizing API, but if your file is actually a higher resolution then a full srcset should be generated automatically.

That said, I did a quick search for that company and their main site right now is using an SVG file, which I would recommend as it will probably be a smaller file while also being as sharp as possible: <https://teamworkhealthcare.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/11/teamwork-healthcare.svg>
any ideas what would be causing HubSpot to have an incomplete list of pages in the sitemap.xml? I am only seeing blogs. not seeing actual pages

<@U02J4GC0B51> - no height or width set on the element themselves. We did set a height and width on the logo in the CMS settings. We resized it to half of the original size with the same dimensions.

<@U26BLKGE4> - super helpful for the research. The SVG worked, and makes sense to use it. Still, I’m a bit confused why the original file was so distorted automatically :thinking_face:
Are those website pages or landing pages? Landing pages are not added by default
Hey all, how do you change the URL of the blog listing page? It automatically attached itself as my index page but would like to change it to /blog

<https://app.HubSpot.com/l/settings/website/blogs/>

that link should take you there. Its under settings > Website > Blog  in the General Tab :slightly_smiling_face:
Thank you!
Anytime!

Hey there,
Just stumble upon a video popup on the HubSpot Career page. The one in the bottom right corner.
Now wondering, is there a module like this available for CMS Hub?
Are there any plans from the HubSpot team to make it available for others?

<https://www.HubSpot.com/careers>
turns out it was because some of the pages were password protected. and also i was expecting instant updates, and it takes up to 10-30 mins to show up

I'm having the hardest time getting the Module builder to work correctly. For example i'm trying to do two things:

1. Have a Name field that is a text field that has a default value and always shows in the preview.
2. Have a e-mail address field that's a text field with a default value. 
For #2, does HubSpot _not_ allow you to have e-mails as a text field and you have to use the actual e-mail field? I tried the URL field and it'll work for approximately half a second then dissapear from the page. Are you not allowed to expose e-mails?

As for #1, I can't get a default to show, and when I enter a name in it's returned as a Array. Like it's not even set to be a repeater field but I still have to do: {% inline_text field="staff_name" value="{{ item.staff_name[0] }}" to access it

Hoping for some direction on this, it seems like the Module Manager just doesn't keep up with itself or something? It also is picking up some weird phantom fields that I created and deleted but I can still access within the editor and shown in Preview.

Hey <@UMZFZHVUJ>! This isn’t actually part of the CMS - it’s an embed from icims (who acquired Altru Labs). There’s more about it <https://www.icims.com/products/talent-cloud-platform/video-studio/|here>.
Hey <@U0336QCR2FQ>! Mind sharing a screenshot of your module fields?

Would JSON work?
EDIT: That's alot of JSON, i'll take photos
full_name has a "default object count" set to 1

The href of the E-mail field defaults to "null" also, as seen here:

<https://21300108.hs-sites.com/drum-shop-bethlehem-nh>

Hmm, I can’t quite tell from the screenshots, so forgive me if I’m misunderstanding. But based on the page, it seems like you want that entire “Team Member” field group to be the repeated object?

If that’s the case, then the “Team Member” field group is the only part of the module that should have “Repeater options” turned on- the individual fields inside it shouldn’t have that turned on (and therefore shouldn’t have a default object count). It might be why they’re returning arrays instead of strings.
That was it! Thanks Michele. Now to figure out how to make the e-mail href _not_ return "null" but the default value
<@U02NJACH5QS> Thanks! Much appreciated!
Ugh, now the images don't want to update on the front end after being set.

Hmm, if you still have the `{% for %}` loop on line 5, that might be the issue with the image. You should be able to access it directly with `item.staff_photo` when the repeater options are turned off.

Not sure what’s up with the email - poking around with an email in a link field on my end.
Yeah that seemed to do it, thank you! And thanks for looking into the e-mail thing
Is there like a _super_ harsh Cache policy with HubSpot?

Hmm, I can’t seem to encounter the same issue with the email field. The only guess I have here- have you already made edits to that field in the page editor? Default values only come through when the field is unedited- making changes to it detached the default value (even if the new value is null).

HubSpot can cache pretty hard, especially combined with your browser cache. Adding `?hsCacheBuster=XXX` to your URL usually gets you a fresh version. I also have luck just adding random query strings (like `?dugfiweug`) as I develop.
I'll try those, thank you again!

So i'm working on a template for the certification. I'm trying to setup a DND section but I can't get the site to listen to the correct offset & width of the modules. In my code I have it set as width = 4, but on the site it gives it span2, even though there is still 2 extra blocks of space. Any idea what i'm doing wrong? Here's the code:

`{% dnd_area "blockedContent" %}`
        `{% dnd_section %}`
          `{% dnd_module path="@HubSpot/linked_image", width=8, img={"src": "<https://fs.HubSpotusercontent00.net/hubfs/21300108/gretsch.png>", "alt": "Gretsch"}  %}`
          `{% end_dnd_module%}`
          `{% dnd_module path="@HubSpot/rich_text", offset=8, width=4, label="Rich Text" %}`
              `{% module_attribute "html" %}`
                `<h2>Here is your headline!</h2>`
                `<p>Here is your content for this block!</p>`
              `{% end_module_attribute%}`
          `{% end_dnd_module%}`
        `{% end_dnd_section %}`
      `{% end_dnd_area%}`

Thanks!

Hi all! I'm not sure if this fits here or not but I thought I'd ask: has anyone built out a sales commission calculator in Operations Hub using Datasets yet? Was curious to learn how folks have tackled that as I haven't seen any examples of them yet in Community postings, etc.
<@U0336QCR2FQ> this is what the editor shows
Hello HubSpot developers! I have a question about adding a Facebook Lead Event code to a button on a form. Anyone able to support this? The help team suggested I reach out here.
Hey Adam! While I haven't built a commission calculator specifically, I've been dabbling in Datasets. I'd be curious to understand your commission formula and think about how it could be done!

Hi! I did a search for "CTAs" to see what folks have to say, but didn't find the specifics I was looking for.

When it comes to building your on-page CTAs, do you prefer to use the native CTA builder tool or do you prefer to code them as simple buttons? What are the advantages/disadvantages that you've experienced?
I did find <https://www.inbounddesignpartners.com/blog/when-not-to-use-HubSpot-call-to-action-buttons|this article> which presents a good case for site speed.

Hello,
I want to add a property in deals, that stores todays date.
 This property needs to be updated everyday at 12:00 am.

What is the best approach to do this ?

Every day at 12:00 am the new timestamp should be populated in this property.

Hi there,
I'm having issues with implementing CSS  on design manager for our page. Been using this article - <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CMS-Development/How-to-style-only-one-menu-item/td-p/34080>
This is regarding making a Nav link look like a CTA button. Does anyone have experience in this area?
